results.title: Bombs will make the rainbows break
results.creator_credit: Barbara Zahm, Tom Hurwitz and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Presents the artwork and writings of many children from the United States and their response to fears about nuclear war. Culminates in a march and demoNstration in Washington where the children’s letters are read aloud in front of the White House.

results.title: Young job seekers package
results.brief_description: Consists of six programmes designed to help young people in the search for work. The segments are titled as follows:- Your first job interview, Preparation, Presentation, Answering questions, Showing initiative, and Improving performance. The program also provides comments from the employers point of view re each applicant. No other credits available.

results.title: Rapids of the Colorado
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Grand Canyon, this non-narrated film follows a raft trip by members of the Sierra Club through the rapids of the Colorado River, recording both the dangers and the beauty of the river.

results.title: One power alone: William Blake

results.title: The Work prejudice film
results.creator_credit: Ray Rivas, Allan Frank Sandler and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Investigates the stereotypes surrounding the world of work relevant to an American situation. Documentation and humour are used to motivate the young person who faces 25 to 45 years in the workforce. Narrated by Robert Vaughn. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Of metals and men
results.creator_credit: John Simmons, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Considers the classification of metals according to their tendency to form compounds or their difficulty of extraction. Discusses the failings of such a classification scheme. Part of the Inorganic Chemistry Concepts and Case Studies series.

results.title: Station in life
results.creator_credit: John Gordon, Frank Torley and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Shows some of the daily activities on a sheep property in the New Zealand high country. Notes the effect of the climate on the husbandry practices at this station and the changes in land use due to soil erosion.

results.title: Fossils: clues to the past
results.creator_credit: Willis Briley, Sidney Platt, Thomas Craven and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Discusses what a fossil is, the ways in which fossils may be formed, what a fossil can tell us and how scientists determine their age. Shows a dig in Montana, USA, and the fossils being discovered.

results.title: But you're a girl
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston, Julie Ruth and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: Shows some of the areas girls have traditionally worked in are no longer certain providers of jobs and then goes on to look at other job options such as trades, apprenticeships and traditionally male dominated professions. Indicates that is is possible for girls and young women to enter these areas, do well in them and enjoy them.
